results.title: Sam Smith: Genuine England
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lee, Arts Council of Great Britain and Shaw Ashton
results.brief_description: An insight into the life and work of Sam Smith, doll-maker extraordinaire. He relates snippets from his life as he discusses the making of his unusual dolls.

results.title: Sam Maloof: woodworker
results.brief_description: Sam Maloof is a craftsman who designs and builds his own furniture. The film demonstrates the working situation, methods and materials used by him. He talks of his philosophy in working with wood and the satisfaction he finds in his work.

results.title: Sam's secret
results.brief_description: An animated instructional piece on selling strategy. Various examples of good and bad selling techniques are shown - centring on the comic character of salesman Sam.

results.title: Salting the earth
results.brief_description: This video looks at the causes of both wetland and dryland salting, its effects and some solutions. No other credits available.

results.title: Salting and soil reclamation
results.brief_description: Explains how the salt concentration in arid soils can be built up due to over-irrigation and removal of overgrowth; how salting can be prevented in irrigation areas by controlled irrigation and how, when salting does occur, the land can be used for pastures or reclaimed and brought back to full production by tile drainage.
results.description: Explains how the salt concentration in arid soils can be built up due to over-irrigation and removal of overgrowth; how salting can be prevented in irrigation areas by controlled irrigation and how, when salting does occur, the land can be used for pastures or reclaimed and brought back to full production by tile drainage.

results.title: Salt: the hidden threat
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: The case against excess salt is accumulating steadily. While it is estimated the body needs only 200 milligrams a day to stay healthy, many people consume 6,000 milligrams a day. In the film, examples are given of hidden salt and suggestions are made about how to reduce the amount of salt in our diets.

results.title: Sale by sample
results.brief_description: This film shows the wool-store operations associated with sale by sample. All operations are clearly shown from receival, the sampling line, and cataloguing to the auction sale. The “close-ups” of the sampling line and the mechanical handling in a single-level wool-store are extremely informative. The commentary is very clear and adequately describes the salient points. The film is recommended for wool-classing at an advanced level. No credits available.

results.title: Salam Cafe. Episode 13 (Season  2)
results.creator_credit: Ahmed Hassan, Jehed Dabab and C31 Melbourne
results.brief_description: ‘Salam Café has no group or organisational affiliation - we’re just a group of mates who thought it might be good to give Melbourne a window on everyday Muslims, and have fun at the same time!’ In this episode Salam Cafe 2 Go visit the MCG on the Grand Final day. The panel interview Qamar Atosh, the National Winner of the YAMY award. Along with our previous guest Monique to discuss the YAMY night. In the absense of Susan, her husband Waleed reveals the winner of the photo comp. We hear about the recent Declaration of Faith Based Schools drafted by representatives of Christian, Jewish and Islamic Colleges.
